Top 11 features of iOS 11

By
Kshitij Gupta
-
Published On: June 6, 2017 | Last Updated: June 6, 2017

“iOS 11 brings iMessage improvements, multitasking improvements for the iPad, and a completely redesigned App Store”

Apple’s Worldwide Developer’s Conference (WWDC) kickstarted yesterday with a keynote that was filled with one announcement after another. Perhaps the iPhone lineup is the only thing that didn’t see any major new update, but that’s expected given the brand hosts a separate event for that in September. From upgraded iMacs and MacBooks to an all new iMac Pro, from new iPad Pro models to the HomePod smart wireless speaker, the hardware side of things had plenty of excitement. That doesn’t mean that software took the backstage, as there were numerous new updates including new features in tvOS, as well as the introduction of watchOS 4, macOS High Sierra and iOS 11. 

The announcement of iOS 11 was arguable the most awaited software update from the keynote. However, if you missed the action because of the timings, or if you just couldn’t keep up with all the new features iOS 11 brings to the table, worry not, as we bring you the top 11 features of iOS 11. Let’s get started. 

Table of Contents

  • 1. iMessage gets a redesign
  • 2. Apple Pay gets person-to-person payment support
  • 3. Siri gets more natural and expressive
  • 4. Camera and Photos are now more efficient
  • 5. The Control Center is back to a single page
  • 6. The App Store receives a major overhaul
  • 7. Your lock screen is now your notification centre
  • 8. Music takes centre stage
  • 9. Apple Maps now support mall and airport guidance
  • 10. Working with Apple Pencil gets much easier
  • 11. iPad specific features: Larger dock, new App Switcher and more

1. iMessage gets a redesign

One of the most used apps in the iOS ecosystem, iMessage, is slated to get minor design overhauls with iOS 11. Last year Apple announced iMessage apps, and to take them one step further, these apps will now be displayed in a tray at the bottom of the iMessage app. Furthermore, with “Messages in iCloud”, the syncing capabilities of iMessage have reached all new highs. Just delete a message on one device, and ta-da, it’ll be gone from all your other synced devices. 

2. Apple Pay gets person-to-person payment support

In an effort to make Apple Pay more useful for casual transactions, the brand has added support for person-to-person payments. Moreover, Apple Pay will also be available as an iMessage app, allowing you to send or receive money through Apple Pay from iMessage itself. Of course, all payments are still secure and require authentication such as your Touch ID fingerprint scan. 

3. Siri gets more natural and expressive

Apple stressed the fact that Siri’s voice, both male and female, will now sound more natural and expressive than ever before. That’s a welcome change given how robotic the personal assistant used to sound in front of competition like Google Assistant. Other updates in Siri include real-time translation from English to Chinese, French, German, Italian and Spanish. Support for more languages is expected to come soon. Moreover, Siri will now use on-device learning to suggest relevant topics to you in various aspects of the OS. For example, if you’ve been searching about some place in Safari, Siri will suggest that place while typing in Mail, Messages and other apps. 

4. Camera and Photos are now more efficient

The Camera app in iOS 11 has been updated to support High Efficiency Video Coding (HEVC), which allows up to twice the compression in videos without affecting the quality. A similar effect can be seen with High Efficiency Image File Format (HEIF), which reduces the size of all photos without affecting their quality. Among other things, Apple now offers more controls over live photos, giving you the option to trim them, choose the key photo and add variance effects like looping and bouncing. 

5. The Control Center is back to a single page

The shift to a multi-page Control Center with iOS 10 wasn’t received as well as Apple had anticipated. So get things back on track, the Cupertino giant has switched to a redesigned single page Control Center that gives you all the quick settings at just the swipe of a finger. What’s more, 3D touching any of the Control Center options presents you with even more settings. This way you can access relevant information without it cluttering the Control Center at all times. 

6. The App Store receives a major overhaul

Over the years, the Apple App Store has proved to be iconic in more ways than one. However, the brand thought that the UI of the storefront has been outdated and needs a complete design overhaul. And that’s exactly what they’ve done to the App Store in iOS 11. The new app comes with different sections like Today, Games and Apps. The Today section will highlight featured apps, including app stories. Meanwhile, the Games and Apps section have been designed to separate Games from other apps, such that looking for either can be easier. If you ask us, the new App Store design resembles the Music app in iOS. 

7. Your lock screen is now your notification centre

The lock screen in iOS 11 is not only improved, but also a place to view all your notifications. Simply pull down from the top of the screen, and you’d be presented with all your notifications in one place. 

8. Music takes centre stage

Apple revealed that it now has over 27 million paid users of Apple music. However, most of what people like to listen is based on what their friends are listening. As such, Apple now allows users to share this information, so that their friends can view what songs they are listening to. Moreover, Apple has also releases MusicKit to developers giving them full access to Apple Music service for better integration. On the other hand, HomeKit has been updated to add support for speakers, including multi-room audio support using Airplay 2.

9. Apple Maps now support mall and airport guidance

iOS 11 brings with itself an updated Maps app which comes with support for indoor mall and airport guidance. In a nutshell, this means that you’d be able to get detailed floor maps, as well as information about where different sections are located right in the Maps app. Of course, at launch this feature will be quite limited and support a handful of places, but the number is expected to grow pretty soon. 

10. Working with Apple Pencil gets much easier

Starting with iOS 11, the Apple Pencil could be used more effectively with the iPad Pro. For instance, the Notes app will support searchable handwriting and inline drawing features, while simple things like tapping on the lock screen with the Apple Pencil will open your most recently opened note. 

11. iPad specific features: Larger dock, new App Switcher and more

The iOS 11 update is a much bigger update for the iPad lineup than the iPhones themselves. iPad users can now place more apps on the dock, with the right side of the dock pro-actively suggesting apps from your installed apps that you might require next. The dock can also be used to quickly jump between apps for better multitasking, or be used to move information from one app to another using drag and drop. Talking about moving between apps, the app switcher has been redesigned for the iPads, and now shows more apps as well as a bunch of controls one finds in the control centre. Adding another dimension of productivity is the new Files app, that shows your documents and files from not only Apple Apps but also third-party cloud storage services like Dropbox and Google Drive.

There you have it. These were the top 11 features in iOS 11. Apart from this, the update also brings support for Do Not Disturb mode while driving, as well as minor updates to the News App, keyboard and Safari. Which of the above features are you waiting for? Do let us know in the comment section below.
